extendedInfo.description: Do you play Blizzard Entertainment games like World of Warcraft or StarCraft II: Wings of Liberty? Protect your Battle.net account with Blizzard's official Battle.net Mobile Authenticator app for your Android device. The Battle.net Mobile Authenticator is an optional tool that offers an additional layer of security to help prevent unauthorized account access. Each time you log in to a Battle.net account, youâll use the Battle.net Mobile Authenticator to generate a unique, one-time use password to use in addition to your regular password. Log in with both and you can rest easy knowing that the account is more secure against unauthorized access.Airtime or Wi-Fi connection required for use. For more information on how to add the Battle.net Mobile Authenticator to your Battle.net account, visit www.battle.net/bma. * Simple and easy to use â just load the app to display the digital code on your Android device.* Convenient â Take your Android device wherever you play World of Warcraft, StarCraft II: Wings of Liberty, and future Battle.net games knowing that the account is secure.* Note: Battle.net Mobile Authenticator is not compatible with online play for âclassicâ Battle.net games, including StarCraft, Diablo II, and Warcraft III. reviews.title: Excellent App
reviews.comment: Excellent, simple app Widget sucks. Easier and quicker to open app than prompt widget to display code.  Working widget would be 5 star (or no widget at all)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Diablo games please
reviews.comment: Android devices are capable of playing the diablo games, please release them on android. The Diablo series is amazing, I\'ve spent 3175hrs playing diablo 3 and even more over the years on diablo 2 and 1.  Diablo has a massive fan base and people would be happy to pay good money to have diablo on their android device. Especially me as my laptop accidentally got bleached and I\'m now saving up to buy another Alienware but don\'t have a spare $8000 at the moment for a new laptop.
reviews.author: Michael Howell

reviews.title: Nearly perfect
reviews.comment: Works perfectly, would be nice if they split the 8 digit number into two 4 digit numbers for easier reading similar to what RSA does with their dongles.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app but can it support multiple accounts?
reviews.comment: I like this app for protecting my WOW accounts. However, can you please implement support for having say 2 or 3 accounts? Maybe having the numbers on the same page? Otherwise I have to rely on an alternative app to protect my 2nd account which feels like I\'m trusting someone else with my Wow authentication details!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nice until you lose access
reviews.comment: I don\'t know which ridiculous policies Blizzard follows, but it is impossible to get your account back once you lose access to the authenticator. First: you can\'t even create a ticket without an account. And once you manage to do so anyway, they ask you for a scan of an ID. And because you can\'t respond to that ticket, you have to create another one, just to find out that all of your three IDs are not \'nationally accepted\' (not even an European passport). They don\'t even state why, and of course to ask you have to create a new ticket.
reviews.author: Robert Luger

reviews.title: Please add an option button
reviews.comment: App is great, but since I changed phones, I\'ve no way to restore it because my new phone doesn\'t have a built-in option button for me to input my restoration code. All I can press are the sync button (with a different serial code) and copy to clipboard. Would highly appreciate the addition of a restore option on the screen itself. :)
reviews.author: Jay Jay Lapid

reviews.title: Works fine
reviews.comment: Does as it supposed to. Had to reset my phone and lost all my info. Was easy to call in to get everything reset. Don\'t forget to write down serial number and restore code to make it easier!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Perfect.
reviews.comment: I\'ve been using this app for almost a year and have never had a problem with it. And it\'s always on hand, more than my old normal authenticator was.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works like it should
reviews.comment: I never had a problem with it. I would recommend that anyone who uses this immediately write down and store your serial and restore code. I had to email Blizzard a copy of my drivers license to get my account reset after switching phones. I am happy that they are strict with resetting accounts, it is just as it should be.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Thunderbolt
reviews.comment: Eric, everything drains the pos battery on a Thunderbolt. Mine is rooted and with custom roms and other tweaks it still sucks. Thank you Blizzard for getting rid of the annoying root warning
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: almost perfect
reviews.comment: I agree with some other reviews here, the way to9 make this better would be split the numbers up into two groups of four. a bit easier to read that way. otherwise great app, protects my account flawlessly.
reviews.author: mikey lasky

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Still does what intended since last update but now the widget don\'t auto update...  you have to manually press on it to get code annoying :(
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great idea
reviews.comment: Only 2 stars because it only works sometimes..i had to remove the security feature from my blizzard account to be able to log in..i will most definitely use once this is fixed
reviews.author: Jason Mercado

reviews.title: People are dumb.
reviews.comment: Funny how they give you a code to reactivate the authenticator after you reinstall it. I\'ve wiped my phone out twice and never had an issue getting it back up and going again. This app is great. People are moronic. Case closed.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: A Must Have App for all Blizzard Gamers
reviews.comment: I highly recommend this app to any Blizzard Gamer, this is the best way to keep your game account locked and secured.  This application works perfectly on Cyanogen Mod 7.2 (Supersonic)  Phone: HTC Evo 4G \"Rooted\"
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Goofs
reviews.comment: Had this on my acc but phone broke and I tried to remove it, and even tho I sent these dumfucks picture is they won\'t remove the auth. Thanks for nothing blizzard no wonder ppl always stop playing and your losing customers.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.comment: Even though I\' ve been playing WoW for 8 years without getting hacked, this app is what I feel to be a convenient update to my account security :-) Way to go Blizzard!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work
reviews.comment: Keep getting \"Network Error\" and \"Server too busy try again later\" Very disappointed. Now I don\'t get the exclusive pet!
reviews.author: Austin Shalit

reviews.title: A simple, secure solution for your account
reviews.comment: It\'s always worked really well for me and it offers good protection for your BN account. It\'s a simple, easy to use app and should have you logging into your account securely within minutes.
reviews.author: Christopher Clayton

reviews.title: Handy
reviews.comment: Could be better, more skins, make it a bit less boring. More blizzard apps? Live wallpapers?
reviews.author: Chris Dow
